Abstract Algorithm: Selection Sort

Verify that the selection sort algorithm sorts a sequence of integers. This example shows the verification of an algorithm working on the level of pseudo code rather than on the level of actual implementation.

The algorithm in pseudo code is taken and translated an according proof obligation in ivil's format.

Selection sort:

Sort sequence a into sequence b (both of length n). 
  b := a;
  i := 0;
  
  if n = 0
  then 
    return
  end;
  while i < n-1 do
    t := i;
    j := i+1;

    while j < n do
      if b[j] < b[t] then t := j end;
      j := j+1
    end;
    
    swap i and t in b;
    i := i+1
  end
